thread.title: Warner leads Senior Men’s Club bowling
thread.title_full: Warner leads Senior Men’s Club bowling

author: Trumbull Times
title: Warner leads Senior Men’s Club bowling
text:
By Trumbull Times on October 18, 2015 in Recreational Sports , Sports Features · 0 Comments 
In Tashua Knolls Senior Men’s Club Bowling at the Nutmeg Lanes, the Tuesday TKSMC League on Oct. 13 has a new team (Team 10: Leo Machado, Bob Vagnini, Tom Constantino and Bob Burke) move into first place with a four-point lead. 
The high scratch single of 254 was by Clint Vogel and the three game series of 604 by Ernie Santo. The single game with handicap was by Gerry Cordone at 286 and Santo had the series with handicap at 706. The individual high average is Vogel at 195.5 and the high individual match point leader is Bob Burke with 26. 
At the Nutmeg Lanes on Oct. 16, the Friday League has (Team 14: Jim Rainey, John DeLeonardo, Rocky DeLorenzo and Angelo Cordone) alone in first place by three points. 
Mike Bartolotta had the high scratch single of 222 and George Warner bowled the high scratch series of 618. Warner also had the single game with handicap of 273 and the series with handicap of 798. The high average individual is Noel Gabrielle with a 224.8 average. Related posts:
